name: Hyatt Place UC Davis

reviews.text: My young son and I stayed here for two nights. The hotel was sparkling clean. The staff was very friendly.The rooms were great. The food was very good. The price was unbeatable. The only drawback was the trains. All night we were woken by them, every hour. I would suggest staying here but bringing ear plugs.
reviews.title: Perfect-minus the trains....

reviews.text: We spent a great night in August. Clean, modern, helpful friendly staff, great bed/bedding, exercise room, quiet, and right on campus. Did not eat there, but definitely will stay again. And low priceline bid! Thanks Hyatt Place! PS air conditioner was on and did not hear trains if they passed.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: We stayed here one night. The hotel was clean, comfortable and still felt new -- probably one of the nicer-looking Hyatts we've been in. Staff was friendly and courteous as well. Free Wi-Fi would have been a great feature had it been working, but it wasn't when we were there. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast but that's a bonus as well.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: The one caveat that other reviewers have also mentioned is that the hotel is right by the train tracks. We were on the fourth floor and it wasn't a problem until we decided to open our window at night. It wasn't an issue as long as the windows were closed, but can't speak to rooms on the lower floors.
reviews.title: great!

reviews.text: this hotel is awesome. it's new, the rooms are big, everything is clean, pretty, and modern, and they have free wifi throughout the entire hotel--no password required!. the staff is super and extremely professional. i slept like a baby and they serve a real complimentary breakfast that actually has hot food and fresh fruit. the location is also really good--especially if you are visiting people at UC Davis. the lobby is nice and airy and has lounge areas that you actually want to sit in. everything about our stay was pleasant and exceeded expectations. we got a great deal on priceline and it ended being about the same price or less than hotels of less caliber in the area.
reviews.title: Like trains?

reviews.text: I had a one night stay for business with the University and was happy to find Hyatt Place on campus. The directions given with the automated phone number misguided me and my GPS couldn't find it. I managed to stumble upon it by following signs for the Mondavi Center for the Performing Arts. I asked for a quiet room and was given a room on the 4th floor. This is a newer area of the campus and I could see the construction area out my window but it didn't bother me. I arrived late in the afternoon and left the hotel before 9:00 A.M., though. The layout of the room was very nice with a large sectional type couch and moveable ottoman. Huge TV could be viewed from the seating area or turned to view from the bed. The staff were very nice and welcoming. The only minus was the train. Thankfully, it didn't come by often but was loud and I could feel the vibration in the couch when it came by. If not for that, I would give the hotel the best rating.
reviews.title: Best for Campus Business

reviews.text: I am sitting in my room right now and I can hear everything above me. Not just people walking across their room.. everything. Voices, toilets flushing, throat-clearing, etc. I am only staying here to get my Platinum status with Hyatt, but the construction is crap. I would recommend anyone staying here to get a room on the 4th floor. Or just stay somewhere with solid construction. Also note, not all of the bathrooms have tubs, so if you want a tub you will need to request one special. Also also, the "queen" size beds are really doubles.
reviews.title: Very thin walls - poor construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the room is very clean and the furniture and linens are in top condition. Too bad I will be listening to my neighbours above!
reviews.title: We even got a Thanksgiving Hug

reviews.text: My wife and I made an overnight stop and stayed at the Hyatt Place on our way to the Bay Area for Thanksgiving. We haven't been back since we went to school there almost 30 years ago, so we were glad to have our GPS. There was still construction in the area, but it was still very easy to get to from the freeway. We requested a quiet King room, and it faced out onto one of the side buildings, so it was perfect. I don't know how long this Hyatt has been here, but everything looked new and very well maintained. The room was very spacious, clean, and comfortable, with a nice sitting/desk area. The TV console had quite the input interface panel (if you ever want to give a presentation from your laptop in your room, you're all set!). The best thing is that the Hyatt Place has everything included - free WiFi, good assortment of TV channels, and free breakfast (unlike the more expensive Hyatt hotels). And the bed was one of the most comfortable we've slept in. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And as we left our room with our luggage in tow the following morning, our housekeeper stopped us and gave each of us a "Thanksgiving hug."
reviews.title: Excellent choice for UC Davis
Convenient, clean, friendly
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel, with a perfect location if UC Davis is your destination; it is located adjacent to campus. Rooms are very large with very comfortable beds and sofas and lots of wood, giving it a positive non-hotel feel. Desk, refrigerator, iron, ice bucket and a huge flat screen tv are all present. It has a large shower and appropriate shampoo and conditioner. The fitness room is small but with free weights and several machines. Towels and water are provided and it is open 24/7 with a room key. Hotel has a pool but I didn't use it in November. Breakfast is included and it was fine-not great- but fine. For other times of the day you can get sandwiches, pizzas, etc. and booze, but there is really no restaurant in the traditional sense. The hotel has a free shuttle to take you into Davis proper but you can also walk it in about 15 minutes. If I had business in the vicinity again, I would definitely select Hyatt Place.

The Bad: We had booked a 2 Queen Suite but when we arrived they had given our room away and had us in a King room so we had to share the bed with the kids and didnt get good sleep. Also, this was the Smallest room I have ever stayed in, I felt claustrophobic at times.
reviews.title: The night before cheer comp

reviews.text: The Good: Super Friendly service, good breakfast, very convenient to be right on campus.
reviews.title: Business Stop

reviews.text: Very nice hotel with lower than average room count (75) for a large chain. The staff was young, cheerful and very proud of their facility. Check in was very simple. The facility is less than three years old and well maintained. One night stay and arrived in the evening. They drove me into town (four blocks away) to a great Thai restaurant (Sophia's) and then picked me up. Could have used a bicycle they offer for free at the hotel however it was too dark. Breakfast was prepared sandwiches with a nice variety of fruit, bagels, cereals and beverages. Very well maintained workout area with free weights and aerobic equipment. Pool is small with no spa. Wi-Fi and electronics in place as would be expected for a university location hotel. Did not visit the small bar located next to the check in desk. Used Priceline "Name Your Price" for a terrific room rate for this three star hotel. Overall a very nice stay.
reviews.title: ☺ Clean, Roomy, Decent Breakfast

reviews.text: We spent two nights on the non-train side of the hotel. Extremely clean lobby, facilities and rooms. Our room was very quiet and generous in size, with a separate large seating area (like a mini-suite). Streamline contemporary furnishings. Computers and printer in lobby. Decent already prepared breakfast, though not made to order. Very limited food selection for lunch and dinner (only a handful of light meals), so need to drive off-campus for a good meal. Good wine available though. Friendly young staff. Only one block away from Mondavi Center for the Performing Arts.
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.text: My wife and I recently had to visit the Vetinary Centre, UC Davis after an emergency with our dog Rex. The entire staff at this hotel could not have been more supportive, friendly and helpful, from Polly the manager thru every person at every level. Most of the staff are former students at UC Davis and make up an amazing team. They multi task, are qualified in every area, and went out of their way to accommodate our every need at a time when we were very stressed and worried about Rex's health. The rooms are clean and spacious, and the breakfast and 24 hour availability of good food and decent wines was a huge plus.The shuttle service was excellent, again run by all the staff so we were never left waiting for a driver. I would rate the staff here as being at least as good as one would find at say a Four Seasons or Rosewood Hotel. A first class hotel and certainly the best in town. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Yes, Yes, Yes

reviews.text: Excellent, very clean and a really nice breakfast provided. The staff is helpful and especially Ingrid who is the House Keeping manager who helped me with a lost item. The meeting room space was good and you are close to facilities on campus that provides entertainment and a short trip to downtown Davis.
reviews.title: Great place ON campus

reviews.text: The Hotel was very clean and the rooms were spacious. The staff were young but very helpful. The rooms at the front of the building face a railroad track and the rooms at the rear were quieter. The breakfast menu was adequate and the lunch and evening menu consists of light meals only. Had the usual problem of getting a decent cup of tea in the USA.
reviews.title: Hyatt place UC Davis

reviews.text: The room was beautiful & clean, all details nicely finished--the shower was gorgeous but had a FLOW-LIMITER which kinda ruined it.
reviews.title: Lovely, lovely hotel & nice people

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was very nice; a little more than the "usual". Better variety.
reviews.title: Lovely Respite

reviews.text: The lobby & breakfast area & outdoor pool area--all very nice. You can tell money has been spent on this hotel.
reviews.title: Davis Hospitality

aka: Hyatt Place Uc Davis Hotel Davis
